WorkItem.ClosedComment: This covers the same feature as http://typescript.codeplex.com/workitem/637, so resolving this to continue discussion on that thread.
WorkItem.Description: Supporting the very nice feature of triple forward slash auto documentation skeleton generation would be excellent!

Comments.Message: Thanks for the comment.  I'll forward this to our internal tracker (where we track the VS plugin changes).

Supporting JsDoc style comments
/**
 * like this
 */

would feel much more natural in JavaScript. The question is whether TypeScript aims to build better type inference-based tooling on top of JavaScript, or smooth the migration path for C# developers.
I vote for jsdoc until vsdoc gets better API-generation tools like jsdocToolkit. Currently, there are zero for vsdoc.
Guys, I didn't say anything about the type of comments generated, why can't triple slash generate JavaScript comments? That's what I'm looking for..
